sections: Stuff The Daily Poster reported this week:
Millionaire Joe Manchin Threatening To Starve His Constituents
“The Start Of Something That Is Very Difficult To Turn Back”
Funders of The Insurrectionist GOP Want You To Forget Their Role
Georgia Wins Would Empower Dems To Repeal Trump Rules
Biden Shift Shows Pressure Can Work
The Washington, D.C., Siege Has Western Roots And Consequences

“The anti-government occupations bookending the rise and fall of Trump’s presidency show the mainstreaming of right-wing extremism in the United States. They also portend the potential for future conflicts here in the West. When President-elect Joseph Biden takes charge of the federal government and its vast Western landholdings, he will enter an already-delicate situation, where armed extremist groups stand ready to rise up against the federal government.”
The Year of Magical Thinking in American Politics
“Trump campaigned on one kind of nostalgia, while Biden campaigned on another. The less regressive vision won out, but we’re still hurtling toward the abyss.”
The Lies Won’t End After Trump Leaves Office

“The lies that have destroyed trust in US institutions didn’t begin with Donald Trump’s presidency, and they will not end with them. From the tobacco industry to fossil fuel companies and the military-industrial complex, the American people have been peddled bullshit for generations.”

“After several years of escalating tension between workers and management at Google, Google workers have publicly launched a  unionization effort—a critical step in an industry where labor has become increasingly organized. Crucially, the union will be open to all of the more than 120,000 employees who work for Google and its parent company, Alphabet.”
How to Get Rich Sabotaging Nuclear Weapons Facilities
A fascinating look at how the private equity industry created a national security crisis.
The connections between a top Biden appointee and a controversial investment vehicle.
Texas Fracking Billionaires Drew Covid-19 Aid While Investing in Rivals
How Ted Cruz helped enrich his fossil fuel industry pals during the pandemic.
What To Expect From A Democratic Congress

I was on Rising to discuss the minimum that we should expect from a Democratic-controlled Congress. We have to go much farther than $2,000 checks and a public health insurance option - we need everything from a much higher minimum wage to Medicare for All.
I’ll keep it short, because after everything that’s happened the last few weeks, I need a break. In fact, I can tell you that the entire

team is exhausted after continuing to report straight through the holiday without a break — and then having everything crescendo in the awful insurrection, which was a psychological blow to the entire country.

The significance of last week’s events cannot be overstated. We saw a president and other elected officials incite an armed assault on the U.S. Capitol, and that should live in infamy for the rest of our lives. Unfortunately, there is already an effort to try to downplay it, and make it seem like just another political conflagration that will fade into the ether.

We cannot let that process of normalization happen. While we cannot let the assault deter us from major priorities like $2,000 survival checks, Medicare for All and jobless aid — we also cannot become so numb to everything happening around us that a violent attack on our government is just seen as another news cycle.

For me, watching the events of this week was like reliving 9/11. On that horrible day, I was in the Capitol complex and then frantically fled the scene with thousands of others being evacuated. The scene was terrifying — and I am sure many people who were at the Capitol this week were similarly traumatized by the chaos and the violence.

While the events of this week were harrowing, they were not entirely surprising. We are working on some reporting that recounts how this was a culmination of many events and trends that have been fueling a right-wing assault on our democracy. So don’t let anyone tell you that this was some spontaneous anomaly — it wasn’t, and the idea that it was is a dishonest ruse to try to downplay what’s really going on.
We will have more on this soon. In the meantime, let me just thank you again for being a supporting subscriber — you are making all of our reporting possible. We couldn’t do it without you.
